Description: Red-brown pottery bowl with rounded base and slightly convex body, interior ledge-rim, incomplete and reconstructed from fragments, the interior is elaborated with white finger-painted dots.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 226)
